body.name: Dr. Teal's Vanilla Lavender Deodorant Gift Set (2 Pack, 2.65oz Ea.) - Shea Butter & Arrowroot Powder Absorb Moisture & Leave Skin Clean & Healthy
body.stockDetail: Only 9 left in stock - order soon.

features: Dr Teal’s Vanilla Lavender Aluminum-Free Deodorant is clinically proven to absorb wetness plus fight odor all day.
This formula harnesses the strength of Magnesium, an essential mineral for your body and a powerful deodorizer, and contains Arrowroot powder and Baking Soda for all-day wetness absorption.
Infused with Essential Oils, Coconut Oil, Jojoba Oil, and Shea Butter to leave your skin smelling and feeling great all day.
Use body heat to soften product. Hold product to skin for several seconds. Gently apply desired amount to clean underarms.
body.description: Dr Teal’s Vanilla Lavender Aluminum-Free Deodorant is clinically proven to absorb wetness plus fight odor all day. This formula harnesses the strength of Magnesium, an essential mineral for your body and a powerful deodorizer, and contains Arrowroot powder and Baking Soda for all-day wetness absorption. Infused with Essential Oils, Coconut Oil, Jojoba Oil, and Shea Butter to leave your skin smelling and feeling great all day. Use body heat to soften product. Hold product to skin for several seconds. Gently apply desired amount to clean underarms. Contains two (2) sticks of deodorant.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Yeah it's a little difficult to apply
reviews.reviewText: It's a little difficult to apply, but that's because we might be a little impatient. The directions say to warm it up in your pits by holding the deodorant in there for a few seconds, essentially, before swiping it around. That does help. It is still a bit resistant to apply, but to be honest, I think a little goes a long way. You don't need a thick coat for this stuff to work.On to my review and why I am giving this 5 stars despite the resistance. I've been using Native for 5 years and I don't know if the formula changed, or my body chemistry, but it just stopped working for me. So I've been on the hunt for a new aluminum free deodorant. I've tried so many deodorants in the past few weeks. Highly rated Mitchum, Old Spice, Speed Stick, etc. I must have tried 6 different deodorants before trying this one. Yes, I read all the reviews and took notice of the reviews about how difficult it is to apply. I tried it anyway and I'm glad I did. ALL of those *other* deodorants I tried did not keep my body odor away. After a few hours I'd find myself smelling like Old Spice and BO. Always BO by the end of the day.This Dr. Teals is the only deodorant that has not given up on me by the end of the day. I notice I'm not as sweaty too, even though this is not an antiperspirant. The scent of this stuff is nice. It's very light and slightly sweet, but not a sickly sweet scent. I think another review mentioned smelling like play dough, I'd say play dough mixed with vanilla. But not in a bad way. It's pleasant, and hey, maybe even nostalgic if it brings you back to your play dough days. I can't complain because it's better than BO. I'm happy to have found this stuff and might see if Dr. Teals has other scents available to try. The formula works very well for me. I'd say if you have the patience, try this stuff out and you might see that it works for you too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This really works
reviews.reviewText: I realized that rubbing aluminum into your pores under your arms probably is not a good thing. I purchased this deodorant on a whim and it really works. No Stinkies even in the blazing heat of the summer. Now, my husband and my son use it as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best for dryness and great smell.
reviews.reviewText: This has been the best deodorant without aluminum and chemicals. Prevents any odors and keeps me dry all day.Only suggestion is to apply it the damp armpits. Spreads much easier.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Smells good, kinda dry
reviews.reviewText: This product smells good, I just don’t like how dry it is. The first few uses it almost kind of chafes your skin, you kind of have to slice off a thin layer before use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best aluminum free deodorant, a little difficult to spread. No rash!
reviews.reviewText: Likes: 1) Awesome scent. 2) Long lasting. 3) No rash whatsoever.Dislike: 1) Need a little "elbow grease" to get an even spread of the deodorant.I had tried other alternative non-aluminum deodorants and they left me with a red rash and itchy underarms. For a long time I had switched back to aluminum spray deodorants. I was desperate to make a change and I am pleased to say that Dr. Teal's is the only aluminum free deodorant that keeps me smelling fresh throughout the work day without any annoying irritation!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars A bit hard to apply
reviews.reviewText: I found this too firm. Feels like I’m scraping it on. Works reasonably well and smells natural.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great, and better value than other aluminum-free deodorants
reviews.reviewText: This stuff works great. It’s not the easiest to apply as the stick is kind of hard, so you have to let the stick warm up and then work to apply it very generously. I sang its praises to my wife, who uses Secret, and she tried it for a while, but she said it didn’t work for her. The problem is that she tried to use it like Secret gel, just a quick zip-zip under the arms. With this stuff you really want to coat it on there, and it takes a little effort, going over the entire underarm and then going over it again. The up side to the hardness of the stick is that it lasts a long time. I don’t mean the odor protection, although that does last a long time, but the stick itself. Even though it feels like you’re using a lot of it, you’re not really, and I can make a stick last a month. I’ve tried other similar magnesium-based deodorants, like Crystal and Dr. Squatch. They’re softer and easy to apply, but they’re also nearly twice as expensive and the stick lasts less than half as long, probably about 10 days. Crystal didn’t work very well at all (it didn’t help that the scent itself smelled kind of like B.O.), but Dr. Squatch worked at least as well as Dr. Teal’s. The problem again with Dr. Squatch is cost and that the stick depletes too quickly. Dr. Teal’s is the one for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It’s an okay product. It was rough going on, and the residue ruined a few of my shirts. I didn’t have an issue with odor while using this, so that’s good. The smell wasn’t overwhelming or so strong that it overpowered any fragrance I used. It’s not the worst deodorant I’ve used, but I won’t be purchasing again.
